case_title: MUHAMMAD RAZAQ vs PROVINCE OF BALUCHISTAN THROUGH SECRETARY HEALTH, QUETTA AND 6 OTHERS
respondents: Province of Baluchistan Through Secretary Health, Quetta

summary.issue: Challenge to the reallocation of seats and admissions to Bolan Medical College, Quetta for the academic session 1976-77.
facts: Petitioners were initially selected by the Selection Committee for admission to Bolan Medical College.
Governor of Baluchistan directed reallocation of seats based on population figures from the 1972 Census, reducing seats for Sibi District from 8 to 6.
High Powered Appellate Committee granted admissions to respondents who scored higher marks than petitioners.

petitioners: Admissions granted to respondents were invalid due to domicile issues.
Petitioners had vested rights to admission after initial selection.
respondents: Reallocation was valid under the Governor's authority.
Respondents scored higher marks and met domicile requirements.

court_findings: Governor had the authority to alter admission policy as per rules in the prospectus.
Petitioners did not acquire vested rights to admission merely by initial selection.
Respondents' admissions were valid as they scored higher marks and met domicile requirements.
summary.decision: Petitions dismissed with no order as to costs.
